::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ──
✔ ggplot2 3.4.0     ✔ purrr   1.0.1
✔ tibble  3.1.8     ✔ dplyr   1.1.0
✔ tidyr   1.3.0     ✔ stringr 1.5.0
✔ readr   2.1.3     ✔ forcats 1.0.0
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(dplyr)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
budget <- read_csv("data/budget.csv", show_col_types = FALSE)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Two ways to do this by listing names or the number of the col. 
# select single column by name
product_dat <- budget %>% select(product) 

# select single column by number
product_dat <- budget %>% select(2) 
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
(knitr::kable(product_dat))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
|product |
|:-------|
|widgets |
|gadgets |
|widgets |
|gadgets |
|widgets |
|gadgets |
|widgets |
|gadgets |
:::
:::
